name: Kepler-349
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-349 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-349 is a star with 0.845 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.93 times its radius. It is located 3152.72 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-349 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-349 b

Kepler-349 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.93 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-349.

The mass of Kepler-349 b is 4.52 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-349 b is 1.9 that of Earth. At 4.52 Earth masses, Kepler-349 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-349 c

Kepler-349 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-349.

The mass of Kepler-349 c is 4.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-349 c is 1.96 that of Earth. At 4.85 Earth masses, Kepler-349 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-349, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
